DataElement.preferredName: Papillary or Follicular (Differentiated) Thyroid Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Under 45 Years Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for papillary or follicular cancer (differentiated) in cases under 45 years of age.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Less Than Age 45 Stage Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05)_A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::45_An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05)

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the thyroid gland and shows extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary or follicular carcinoma.

Property.preferredName: Less Than Age Integer::45 Stage Grouping
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::45:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 5/16/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under Age 45 American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05)_A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::45_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 45 Years

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 45 Years
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: Any T, Any N, M1.  M1: Distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 45 Years AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: Any T, Any N, M1.  M1: Distant metastasis.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 45 Years

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 45 Years
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any T, Any N, M0.  M0: No evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Under 45 Years AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: Any T, Any N, M0.  M0: No evidence of distant metastasis.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that the extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

Concepts.definition: The extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Less Than Age Integer::45 American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage Grouping Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05):A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::45:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the thyroid gland and shows extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary or follicular carcinoma.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
